message.content:
Here's a JavaScript function that uses regex to extract a three character code from a filename in the given format:

```javascript
function extractThreeCharacterCode(filename) {
  const regex = /^(\d{2})-([a-zA-Z0-9]{3})\.usfm$/;
  return filename.match(regex)[2];
}
```

You can use this function like so:

```javascript
console.log(extractThreeCharacterCode('57-1Jn.usfm')); // Outputs: "1Jn"
```
The regex used in the function is explained as follows:

- `^`: Start of the string
- `(\d{2})`: Capture group 1 (first parentheses): Two digits
- `-`: Hyphen
- `([a-zA-Z0-9]{3})`: Capture group 2 (second parentheses): Three upper or lower case letters or digits
- `\.usfm$`: End of the string and ".usfm" extension

The function returns the content of capture group 2, which is our three character code.
